intro: Aconogonon platyphyllum, commonly known as the flat-leaf aconogonon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in summer. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
